Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Victoria de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
49-year-old Victoria is a cheerful woman.  She lives together with her daughter Rosmery, who she cares for in her own home, in the village of Huasapuquio.  Victoria has been farming since she was very young.  This business allowed her to support her daughter through her own means as she doesn't have a husband.  In spite of the fact that she is now older and her daughter is independent, she continues working.  Her business is buying and selling fresh, good-quality cheese.  Every two weeks she travels to the country's capital city where she sells cheese to customers who are already familiar with her business.  In addition, she says that "if strength is on her side" she also sows corn, beans and potatoes, for her own consumption, in small vegetable gardens.  Victoria owns three cows and two calves that she provides with a lot of care as they provide her with the milk she needs to carry out her business.  However, as they don't produce milk constantly, she also buys cheese from third parties to fill her orders.

This is Victoria's sixth loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her plans.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys being part of her association because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Victoria will invest the money she has requested in buying a cow to increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mohamed Fuad

texts.en: Pictured above is Mohamed, a secondary school teacher in Makeni. Mohamed has twelve years of experience in the teaching profession. He has requested a loan from Kiva, through Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to buy house building materials – iron, corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc. for the construction of a house. A native of Makeni city, forty-three-year-old Mohamed is married to a teacher and the couple has five children.

loans.use: to buy iron, corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, rods, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en: Prossy lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (late sister’s child). Prossy has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Prossy sells her products from home. Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Prossy include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to go to villages for charcoal. Prossy lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, pero solo tiene uno a su cargo y el otro ya se independizo. Ella se ha dedicado a realizar oficios domésticos, su familia es muy unida, responsable y honesta. Su hijo le ayudara a pagar el crédito ya que es empleado.

El préstamo que Maria esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para mejorar su vivienda ya que es de bahareque, es una casa muy humilde. Ella comprara madera, cuartones, varas de tuza, varas de bambú, clavos, tejas y para pago de mano de obra. De esta manera María dispondrá de un lugar más seguro, cómodo para su familia y de mayor duración. 

Ella lo que desea es construir su casa de adobe o bloque, comprar cerdos para engordarlos y venderlos, comprar ganado vacuno y vacas e instalar una granja de pollos de engorde y gallinas ponedoras. Todo esto lo quiere alcanzar con el apoyo de Fundación Campo y el de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and the single mother of two children.  Only one of her children is in her care and the other is already independent.  She has done domestic work.  Her family is very close, responsible, and honest.  Her son will help her pay back the loan because he works.

The loan that María is requesting from Fundación Campo is to improve her home because it is made of adobe.  It is a very modest house.  She will buy wood, beams, corn husk poles, bamboo poles, nails, and tiles, and will pay for labor.  In this way María will provide her family with a safer and more comfortable place, and for a longer time.

What she wants is to build her house of adobe or cinderblock, to buy pigs for fattening and sale, to buy cattle, and to set up a farm for breeding chickens to sell and for laying hens.  She wants to achieve all this with the support of Fundación Campo and her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, beams, corn husk poles, bamboo poles, nails, and tiles, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Leonidas quien es mototaxista, fruto de esa unión tienen 03 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Sandra es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con 02 moto taxis, uno lo maneja su pareja y el otro lo alquila a un vecino que considera responsable por un tarifa diaria, generándose de esa manera unos ingresos económicos. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 02 años, empezando con la compra de un moto taxi con un capital propio. Es así que se inicio en el servicio de tranasporte, por ser un negocio muy rentable en esta parte del país. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos sin realizar mucho esfuerzo. Ahora solo ella se dedica en dar buen mantenimiento de su vehículo. Tiene planes de abrir un negocio de venta de lubricantes para motos y moto taxi. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus moto taxi como llantas.
texts.en: Sandra is 30 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who is eager and determined to succeed.  She lives with her partner Leonidas, who is motor-cycle taxi driver.  They have three children who they love very much, and they all live together in their own home.  Sandra has a passenger transportation service for which she has two motor-cycle taxis.  Her partner drives one and she rents the other one to a neighbor who she holds responsible for the daily fares, thereby generating some income.  She has been in this business, which she started by purchasing a motor-cycle taxi with her own capital, for about two years.   In this way, she began her transportation service, a very profitable business in this part of the country.  She enjoys her business because she generates income without making much effort.  At the moment, she is personally responsible for proper maintenance of her vehicles.  She plans to open a business and sell lubricants for motor-cycles and motor-cycle taxis.  This will be her third loan with the MFP institution.   She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as she will feel secure in moving her business forward.  With the 800 nuevos soles she is requesting, she will purchase spare parts such as tires to maintain her motor-cycle taxis.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires for her motor-cycle taxi.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Sarah has a bakery. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Sarah sells her products from home. Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baking flour, baking powder, and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and the increasing prices of sugar and cooking oil. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to own a big bakery. Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, and baking powder

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a business of selling tomatoes. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market. Florence has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes. The main business challenges for Florence include perishability and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start growing tomatoes.  Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Hilda Edith

texts.es: Hilda Edith de cincuenta años de edad vive con su hijo en un lugar muy concurrido de personas,  lo cual es muy beneficioso para su tienda, donde vende productos de de primera necesidad como frijoles, leche, pan, entre otros últimamente ha aumentado la demanda y Hilda no quiere decepcionar a sus clientes, por eso quiere seguir surtiendo su tienda con productos de excelente calidad y vender siempre a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer emprendedora con grandes objetivos para su futuro, piensa que para triunfar en la vida, no es importante llegar el primero sino llegar y sentirse satisfecho de lo logrado, quiere seguir ese camino de éxito es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, golosinas, productos instantáneos, granos básicos, bebidas, lácteos etc. Hilda Edith tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hilda Edith, 50 years of age, lives with her son in a place well frequented by people, which is very beneficial for her store, where he sells general supplies such as beans, milk, and bread, among other things.  Ultimately she has grown demand for her products and Hilda does not want to disappoint her clients, therefore she wants to continue supplying her store with products of excellent quality and to sell always at very affordable prices.  She is an enterprising woman with large goals for her future.  She thinks that to succeed in the life, it is not important to arrive first but only to arrive and to be satisfied of what you have achieved.  She wants to continue that road of success.  That is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy snacks, instant foods, basic grains, beverages, milk etc.  Hilda Edith has confidence that with her efforts she will be able to bring economic security to her home and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, instant foods, basic grains, beverages, and milk.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Cruz, tiene 35 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa en la comunidad de Las Delicias Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Desde hace 5 años se graduó de técnico en estructuras metálicas y decidió indiciar un negocio fabricando puertas, balcones, portones. Con los ingresos obtenidos  ha logrado establecer su propio taller de soldadura.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 6500 lempiras, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de más herramientas y accesorios de uso en la soldadura y así poder mejorar la atención de sus clientes.
Don Cruz es una persona muy activa ya que ha participado en las organizaciones locales de su comunidad ejerciendo el cargo de tesorero.
El espera incrementar sus ingresos para obtener una mejoría en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Cruz is 35 years old.  He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife in the community of Las Delicias, in the municipality of Choloma in Cortes.

Five years ago, he graduated in metal structures from technical school and decided to start a business manufacturing doors, balconies and gates.  With the income he has earned, he has been able to establish his own soldering workshop.

He is currently requesting a loan for the amount of 6,500 lempiras, which he is planning on investing in the purchase of more tools and accessories for use in soldering, and in this way be able to improve the service he gives his customers.

Don Cruz is a very active person who has participated in his community's local organizations in the role of treasurer.

He hopes to increase his income so as to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.ru: Давлатмурод более пяти лет занимается скотоводством. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Davlatmuro has been raising cattle for more than five years. Mainly he breeds cattle future resale. He is thirty years old, is married, and has three children. He is requesting a loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: To buy bulls

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 30 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Lucio, desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos todos ellos menores a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, siembra de papa y maca en terrenos propios; por la zona alta de la ciudad. Los cuales vende en temporadas de cosecha a un reconocido mercado de la zona. Pero hace 3 meses, abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde vende frutas, leche y demás productos de primera necesidad. Pues no tiene las mismas fuerzas de antes para sembrar en gran cantidad. Por ello comenzó a abrir un negocio. Además su esposo trabaja en una mina, donde percibe un sueldo fijo; que le permite mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Se esfuerza mucho, pues tiene que cuidar de ellos sola, durante toda la semana, ya que su esposo regresa de trabajar los fines de semana donde la familia se reúne. Este es el  primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Elizabeth, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 30, is a simple woman. She has been living with her husband, Lucio, for 12 years. They have four children, all minors, whom they are raising in their own home, located in the city of Pampas. Her principal work is agriculture: she plants potatoes and maca (an indigenous root crop) on their own land in the upper area of the city.  She sells her crops at harvest to a well known market in the area.

Three months ago Elizabeth opened a small grocery store where she sells fruit, milk and other staples. Consequently she does not have the same energy as before to do extensive planting. In addition her husband works in a mine where he earns a fixed wage that enables him to support their small children. She works hard because she has to care for her children alone during the week since her husband only returns from working on the weekends when the family is reunited. 

This is Elizabeth’s first loan with MFP and she awaits your collaboration so that she can concretize her plans. She promises to make all her payments on time. As well, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. Upon receiving your help, she will invest the money in the purchase of staples for her store.

loans.use: to buy staples.

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
La Señora María, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos (3, 15,17, y 19) reside en la aldea de Isleta, ubicada en el Municipio de Omoa. Ella trabajaba de cocinera en un restaurante y con las prestaciones laborales que obtuvo, decidió emprender un negocio de pulpería donde vende alimentos y abarrotes (arroz, frijoles, pastas, huevo, azúcar, sal, refrescos y lácteos). Ha solicitado un préstamo de 5000 Lempiras para surtir mas el negocio ya que mantiene demanda de estos productos, pues en la comunidad es el único negocio existente.
Doña María espera mejorar sus ingresos para hacer crecer su negocio y suplir la demanda de alimentos en su comunidad, para lo cual trabaja 15 horas diarias.
texts.en:
Señora María is 39 years old.  She is married with four children (aged 3, 15, 17, and 19), and lives in the village of Isleta, located in the Omoa municipality.  She used to work as a cook in a restaurant, and with the work experience that she obtained, she decided to open a convenience store business where she sells food and groceries (rice, beans, pasta, eggs, sugar, salt, beverages and dairy products).  

She has requested a loan of 5,000 Lempiras to stock up her business as she has demand for these products, and is the only business of this kind that exists in her community.

Doña María hopes to improve her income so that she can grow her business and meet the demand for groceries in her community.  To do this, she works 15 hours a day.

loans.use: to purchase everyday grocery products.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La Señora Sara, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos (23 y 25 años) reside en la aldea de Potreros, ubicada en el Municipio de Omoa. 
En el pasado se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, posteriormente con el apoyo de sus hijos y algunos ahorros que poseía, emprendió la actividad de producción y venta de pan (quesadilla, empanadas y tortas). 
Esta actividad le genera buenas utilidades ya que tiene muchos clientes debido a la variedad y calidad de producto que ofrece. 
Doña Sara produce pan una vez por semana, el cual distribuye en su comunidad. Con las utilidades obtenidas ha realizado reparaciones a su horno y comprado más producto. 
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras para la compra de materia prima para su negocio, ella espera en un futuro abastecer de pan a las aldeas vecinas.
texts.en:
Señora Sara is 53 years old.  She is a single mother with two children (aged 23 and 25), and lives in the village of Potreros, in the Omoa municipality.

In the past, she worked selling clothing.  Subsequently, with the help of her children and some saving that she had put aside, she began making and selling baked goods (quesadillas, empanadas and cakes).

This activity has generated good profits for her, as she has many customers due to the variety and quality of products that she offers for sale.

Doña Sara bakes her products once a week, which she then distributes for sale in her community.  With the profits obtained, she has made repairs to her oven and purchased additional products.

Currently she has requested a loan for the sum of 10,000 Lempiras for the purchase of raw ingredients for her business.  She hopes in the future to supply baked goods to the nearby villages.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Castula Bonfilia

texts.es:
La  señora Cástula Bonifacia  es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de refrescos de diferentes sabores como son: Fanta, sprit, manzanita y coca cola.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Ramiro con quien tienen dos hijos quienes la ayudan a atender a sus clientes cuando ella no está.
También se dedica a la venta de bisutera como son: bolsas, carteras, diademas y juegos para cocina.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más refrescos para la venta también para la compra de jugos de naranja.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a seguir creciendo cada día mas.
texts.en:
Cástula Bonifacia is a hard-working lady who sells different flavors of soft drinks such as Fanta, Sprite, Manzanita and Coca Cola.  She is happily married to Ramiro and the couple have two children who help serve her customers when she isn't there.

Cástula also sells costume jewelry, bags, billfolds, hairbands and cooking utensils.  She requested this loan to buy more soft drinks to sell.  She will also buy orange juice.  She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping her to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, costume jewelry, bags and ladies' accessories

loans.name: Lorenza   Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta  antojitos mexicanos como son: enchiladas, entonatadas, tacos dorados y empanadas de pollo.
Es viuda pero a pesar de todo a podido ser madre y padre para su hijo ya que trabaja para darle un mejor futuro y que todos los días se sienta orgullosa de su madre.
Tambien  se dedica a la venta de tabicon para la construccion.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar ingredientes  como son: jitomate, cebolla, ajos, pollo, maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por ayudarlas a seguir adelante  con su hijo a quien quiere y desea ayudarlo a terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a hard-working lady who sells Mexican snacks such as enchiladas, entonatadas, fried tacos and chicken empanadas.  Lorenza is a widow but, in spite of everything, she has managed to be both mother and father to her son as she has worked to provide him with a better future.  Every day, she feels proud to be his mother.

Lorenza also sells blocks for the building trade.  She requested this loan to buy ingredients such as tomatoes, onion, garlic, chicken and corn for making tortillas.  She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping her to provide for her son as she loves him and would like to help finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, three of whom go to school. Janepher has operated a beauty salon business for 5 years, working 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, at the retail level.

Janepher has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of braids, weaves and cream relaxers. Janepher's main business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and hopes are to own a bridal salon and to build her own house. Janepher lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, de 24 años es una mujer buena. Vive en compañía de Ronald, su esposo desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos; Ronald y Ana Lucia a quienes cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. Hace poco tubo que afrontar una responsabilidad grande, ya que su madre falleció dejando a sus 2 menores hermanos a su cargo. Muy hábil ella miro en su limitación una oportunidad, por ello abrió una pequeña zapatería, junto a su hermano Romeld, de 18 años. Está segura de que podrá tener muchos éxitos, pues cree en Dios y su infinito poder. Además sigue dedicándose a la agricultura, trabajando como peón en terrenos agrícolas que entran en cosecha, donde recibe un sueldo de 30 soles por día, su esposo la ayuda cada vez que pueda, pero cuando recibe trabajos de mantenimiento de obras en el gobierno de su localidad, aprovecha la oportunidad para ganar un dinero extra y así mantener a su familia. Ayudando también a su esposa en lo que pueda. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Nelly de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales para su zapatería.
texts.en:
Nelly, 24, is a good woman. She has been living with her husband, Ronald, for 5 years. They have two children, Ronald and Ana Lucia, whom they are raising in their own home located in the town of Daniel Hernández. 

A little while ago Nelly had to take on a major responsibility when her mother died and left two minor brothers in her care. Very adeptly she saw in this loss an opportunity because she opened a small shoe store, together with her 18 year old brother, Romeld. She is certain she will be very successful because she believes in God and his infinite power. In addition she continues in agriculture, working as a laborer on land that is ready for harvest, where she receives a salary of 30 soles a day. Her husband helps her in any way he can, however when he has maintenance work from local government, he takes advantage of the opportunity to earn extra money and thereby support his family, while still helping his wife when possible. 

This is Nelly’s fourth loan with MFP where she awaits your collaboration so that she can concretize her plans. She promises to make all her payments on time. Also, she is glad to be part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive. Upon receiving your support, Nelly will invest the money in the purchase of material for her shoe store.

loans.use: to purchase materials to epuip her shore store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La  señora  Josefina es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta  de mercancía de abarrotes como es : aceite,cebolla,café,leche,pan,galletas,refrescos,jugos y cereal.
Es viuda  no tiene  hijos, ella nos cuenta que está orgullosa de ella misma ya que  se considera una mujer que se ha mantenido sola  desde pequeña y gracias a dios a podido salir adelante y seguir luchando día a día.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es : leche,cereal,café,aceite,manteca,refrescos,yogurt y pan.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyarla cada día para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Señora Josefina is a hard-working woman who works selling grocery merchandise such as oil, onions, coffee, milk, bread, cookies, sodas, juice and cereal.

She is a widow, and has no children.  She tells us that she is proud of herself, as she considers herself to be a woman who has supported herself on her own since she was young, and thanks to God, has been able to move ahead in life and continue striving day to day.

She asked for the loan for the purchase of more grocery merchandise, such as milk, cereal, coffee, oil, butter, sodas, yogurt and bread.

She gives thanks to the Foundation for helping her each day, so that her business grows.

loans.use: to purchase grocery merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María  es madre soltera pero gracias al apoyo de  fundación  se dedica a la venta de comida para ayudar  a su hijo en lo que necesite.
Ella vende lo que es: enchiladas verdes, enchiladas rojas, tostadas, tacos dorados y sopes.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes como es: cebolla, chile verde, chile seco, jitomate, tomate y ceite, queso   y pollo.
Le da las gracias a  fundación por apoyarla cada día mas para seguir adelante  con su hijo y su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María is a single mother, but thanks to the support of the Fundación, she works selling food to support her son in what he needs.

She sells enchiladas in green sauce, enchiladas in red sauce, tostadas, fried tacos and soups.

She asked for the loan for the purchase of more ingredients such as onions, green chili, dried chili, tomatoes, green tomatoes and oil, cheese and chicken.

She gives thanks to the Fundación for supporting her each day in getting ahead more in life with her son and with her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: La Paz 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of the La Paz (Peace) 1, 2 & 3 group, which is located in the area surrounding Samana, where these 15 borrowers sell their products. All of the group members are dedicated to doing business around their community and other villages, selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and many other products.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She is starting to invest in her beauty salon by purchasing beauty and hair products and a hair dryer. Maria started her business after studying to be a beautician. She saved up the wages she earned in a salon where she was working until she made enough money to have her own salon. Maria will use her profits to reinvest in her business.

Maria is a married woman with three children. She enjoys being with her family and serving her clients. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair products and a dryer.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.en:
Manesa is a member of the “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) 1 & 2 group. She is the mother of three children, who live with Manesa and her long-term partner in one of the slum neighborhoods located in the north of Santo Domingo. Manesa tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to devote herself as a mother to give her children a better future.

Manesa is very excited to receive her fifth loan with Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around eleven years, after having arrived in the Dominican Republic and seen the need to start working. She used a little bit of capital for food sales. Manesa is planning to invest her new loan to purchase foods such as rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil, and meats. She will use her earnings to continue investing in her business in order to improve her sales and to save to finish building her house.

Manesa will achieve her dream of being able to finish building her house. She also wishes to have good health and a life that is more economically stable. She started her association with Esperanza because the payments are much more flexible and the interest is lower.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, cooking oil, and meats

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 50 años es una mujer ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Richard, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con Juliana y Cumar, a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampas. Ella se siente agradecida con su asociación, pues gracias a ellos adquirió su tienda de comestibles, de eso hace 4 años. Según cuenta fue la institución que le brinda la mano para comenzar su negocio. Donde le va muy bien, ya que es conocida y los clientes le vistan muy seguido. Además su esposo es conocido en toda la ciudad, pues el es un trabajador independiente que hace 30 años rellena formularios y hace trámites para las personas que lo necesiten, todos en el pueblo requieren de su servicio, por ello obtiene buenas ganancias. Con lo que pudieron construir la pequeña casa donde viven. Ahora, desea abrir un  restaurante, donde solo pueda ofrecer bebidas de toda variedad, ya acondicionó un espacio en su casa y espera arreglarlo con sillas y un ambiente adecuado para sus clientes. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Elena, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la construcción de su nuevo local.
texts.en:
Elena, 50 years old, is an exemplary woman. She lives with Richard, her husband for 30 years. They have 5 children, but only Juliana and Cumar live with them, growing up in their own home, located in the town of Pampas. 

She is grateful to the association because thanks to them she acquired a grocery store, four years ago. It was the institution that gave her a hand in order to open her business where things are going very well. She is known and the customers visit her often.

Also, her husband is known throughout the city. He has been an independent worker for 30 years filling out applications and taking care of paperwork for people that need it, and everyone in the village needs his service, so he makes a good profit.

With what they could, they built the little house where they live. Now they want to open a restaurant where they could offer drinks of all kinds. She has already fixed up a space in her house and she hopes to accommodate it with chairs and an adequate environment for her customers. 

This is the 5th loan with MFP, and she hopes for your cooperation so that she can finalize her plans. Also, she promises to complete her payments, and she likes being a part of the association because all of the members are trustworthy and supportive. Elena, upon receiving your help, with use the money from the loan in the construction of her new facility.

loans.use: to build a new facility for her store

loans.name: Urema

texts.es:
La señora Urema es  vive en una localidad pequeña ella es casada con  señor  Esteban con quien procreo dos hijas que a un están a su responsabilidad.

    Solicito el préstamo en la compra de  frutas y verduras, como son: manzanas, uva, repollo, coliflor, cebolla, tomate, chayote, entre otros en donde lleva trabajando ocho meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado sus ingresos.
 
   Ese inspiro por la ayuda de su esposo quien es el que se encarga de salir a vender ya que ella está recién operada, aun así le va  bien.
 
   Lo quemas desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda seguir trabajando con el préstamo  y logre aumentar sus ingresos para su  hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Urema lives in a small village.  She is married to Señor Esteban, with whom she has two daughters, for whom they are still responsible.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of fruits and vegetables, such as apples, grapes, cabbages, cauliflowers, onions, tomatoes and squash, among other things.  She has spent eight months working in this way, and comments that it is going well for her as she has been able to increase her income through this.

She is inspired by the help of her husband, who is in charge of selling as she has recently had surgery.  She is still doing well.

What she most desires is for this small business activity to continue through the loan, and she can increase her household income.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa  vive en unión libre con el señor  Oscar y con quien procreo  un hijo que tiene la edad  de diez años.

    El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes en donde lleva trabajando  dos años y siete meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya  que con ello a logrado  mejorar sus ingresos para su familia.

    Se inspiro para  así  poder tener ingresos  para su familia   y darle lo más necesario  a su pequeño hijo.

Lo que más  desea es que con esta actividad  y el préstamo   es que a un puedas seguir trabajando para construir un lugar más amplio y estar pendiente de negocio y familia.
texts.en: Teresa lives with her common-law husband Oscar, with whom she has a 10-year-old son. She plans to use the loan to invest in merchandise to stock her grocery store, where she has been working for two and a half years. She says that it is going well and that she has been able to increase her family's income. She is motivated to keep earning for her family and to provide more for her son. What she wants most for her job is to keep working so she can build a bigger store and be devoted to her business and her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Boyambi Plus Group

texts.en:
Christian is the leader of the Community Bank named “Boyambi Plus”, which is composed of 27 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Christian is 28 and single. He has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. He operates a general store in Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a larger store in Kinshasa. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business, which earns him $40 per week. He works to the best of his abilities so that he might achieve his goals. Christian is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having two times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying cans, sacks of sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. Christian is happy to be Hope’s client.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sacks of sugar and milk to sell.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Las Flores 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group, Las Flores 1, 2 & 3 (The Flowers), located in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. This group is composed of 15 businesswomen, all dedicated to doing business around their community and in other neighborhoods in the city. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded. 

Lourdes and her long-term partner have two children and live in a simple home in Santiago. Lourdes sells Avon products; she shows the catalog to her clients and they order items from it. She also operates a food stall where she sells 'Riky' (a meatball sandwich, very popular on the north coast of the country) in the morning and at night. Lourdes will use this loan to invest in both businesses, by purchasing beef, bread, ketchup, mayonnaise and other ingredients for her food stall and by purchasing more inventory of popular and sales products for her Avon business. 

This is Lourdes’s fifth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her businesses and to improve her family's home life.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, ketchup, mayonnaise and cosmetic products

loans.name: Everlides Isabel

texts.es: Everlides de 36 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 9 a 18 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su cónyuge y se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos, en  un local ubicado en la plaza mayorista del mercado público de los plátanos desde hace 5 años; aunque su experiencia data desde hace 8 años,  cuando empezó en su propia casa,  con la venta de bollos de mazorca en compañía de su cónyuge y un capital de trabajo muy pequeño;  con su esfuerzo, constancia y disciplina de trabajo lograron aumentarlo, ampliando su cobertura hacia un corredor comercial del mercado donde funciona en un local en calidad de arrendamiento. En Everlides aun persiste   su deseo de hacerlo crecer, y mejorar sus instalaciones cada vez más, pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para lograr las metas que se propone. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos de producción de comida, arreglará el mesón de cocina y reparará la nevera donde refrigera los productos cárnicos. Sus clientes iniciales fueron los vecinos y clientes del sector y después cuando amplió su cobertura,  hasta el lugar donde actualmente se encuentra, cuenta  con clientes como los vendedores del comercio formal e informal que los circunda, con quienes les han ido muy bien, por eso allí se concentró, creció y ahora cuenta  con  dos empleados dirigidos por ella, mientras  su esposo distribuye mercancía en las poblaciones del municipio del departamento del Atlántico, donde también le ha ido muy bien porque ha sido acogido por una gan clientela.
texts.en: Everlides is 36 years old. She has four children ranging in age from 9 to 18. She lives with her husband and she's a very hardworking woman. She sells breakfasts and lunches in a place located in the wholesale square of the public market of Los Plátanos. She has been doing this for five years, although her experience dates back eight years. That's when she, along with her husband, began selling corncob rolls from her own home, with very little working capital. Through their hard work, perseverance and work discipline, they succeeded in expanding the business into a rented spot at the commercial aisle in the market. Everlides still wishes to have the business grow and to keep on improving her facilities, but her working capital is insufficient for achieving her goals. This is the reason why she turns to credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase supplies for food making, fix the kitchen counter and repair the fridge where she stores meat products. Her first customers were neighbors and local customers, and after she expanded into the spot where she is currently located, she gets customers such as the salespeople from both the formal and informal retail businesses around her. She has been getting along with them very well and for that reason she stayed there, expanded the business and now she has two employees under her supervision. Meanwhile, her husband distributes goods in the villages of the municipality of the Atlantic deparment, where he also has been doing well because he has been well-received by a large clientele.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for food making, to fix the kitchen counter and to repare the fridge where she stores meat products.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 24 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Rui, su esposo. Con quien tiene un hijo Pool; a quien cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. A pesar de su corta edad, logró obtener muchas cosas y tiene más objetivos por cumplir. Hace poco compró su casa, con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro. Para no perder el tiempo abrió hace 8 meses una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Paralelo a ello y mientras atiende a sus clientes, se dedica a la bordar fustanes típicos que se usan para fechas festivas, ahí obtiene buenas ganancias; ya que es conocida y los clientes saben de la calidad de sus bordados. Los meses donde obtiene más ganancias son en julio y agosto. Por ello quiere abrir una tienda donde pueda vender su trabajo, ya está comenzando y espera concluir todo en estos meses. Por su parte su esposo, trabaja en un proyecto de energía y minas para el estado peruano en esa parte del país, donde se requiere de la aplicación del proyecto, ahí obtiene un sueldo fijo mensual con el que mantiene los gastos del hogar. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Liz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad ara surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Liz, 24, is a simple woman. She lives with her husband, Rui, with whom she has a son, Pool, whom they are raising in their own home, located in the town of Daniel Hernández.

Despite her young age, Liz has succeeded in accomplishing many things and has more goals to meet. She bought her own home a short while ago, through a great deal of effort and careful saving. In order not to waste time, she opened a grocery store 8 months ago where she sells basic staples. Simultaneously, and while waiting on customers, she embroiders traditional petticoats that are worn at festivals. Consequently, she makes a good living since she is well known and her clients know about the quality of her embroidery. Liz’s best months for earnings are July and August. Therefore she wants to open a store where she can sell her embroidered goods since she is already starting her embroidery and expects to finish everything by these months. 

Liz’ husband works for the Peruvian state on an energy and mines project and thus receives a fixed monthly salary with which he pays household expenses.

This is Liz’ first loan with MFP and she awaits your collaboration so she can concretize her plans. She promises to meet her payments on time. As well she likes being part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. Upon receiving your support she will invest the money in purchasing staple products to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase staples to stock her store.

loans.name: Bellarmina

texts.es:
La señora  Bellarmina  es casada con el señor  Audon y con quien procreo tres hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad.
 
     El préstamo lo invertirá en la copra de marranos para engordarlo  y después venderlo fuera de su localidad, en donde lleva trabajando  tres años  siete meses y le  va bien en sus ingresos.
   
     Empezó con su actividad  para poder apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y darle lo más necesario para su familia que es lo más importante para ella.

     Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  pueda seguir trabajando   para  comprar material  y construir una casita más amplia para su familia.
texts.en: Bellarmina is married to Audon, with whom she has three children under her care. She plans to use the loan to purchase pigs to fatten and later sell outside of her community. She has three and a half years of experience in this work and things are going well. She started working to support her husband with household expenses and provide for her family, which is of utmost importance to her. She wants to continue with her small business so she can buy materials and build a bigger home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Daniel S.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, is very pleased to present to you Daniel, a secondary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. 

Daniel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to invest it in his business. He will use it to buy ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. for the production of a large quantity of gara cloth (locally dyed cloth) for sale.

Thirty-one-year-old Daniel was born in Binkolo village near Makeni and is married to a businesswoman. The couple has one child who is attending primary school. Daniel has been a professional teacher for four years now.  However, he backs his teaching profession with some supplemental trading.

loans.use: to buy ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc. for the production of a large quantity of gara cloth for sale.

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Enriketa is the coordinator of her group 'Minerva Mirabal 2 & 3' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so). This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. Enriketa makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her most important challenge is to finish studying. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew.

Enriketa is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting when she received her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for her little colmado (convenience store) where she sell rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, cooking oil, and vegetables. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and finish building her home.

Enriketa began with us because she wanted to have a business. She is a young mother (she is wearing a pink blouse in the first photo). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, cooking oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Union De Mujeres En Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Emiliana is the coordinator of her group Union De Mujeres En Desarrollo 1, 2 & 3, which is composed of 15 women entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area surrounded by fields of sugarcane. Emiliana has operated a business selling clothes and shoes for five years. She will use her loan to purchase clothing and some shoes for women and men. Emiliana and her long-term partner live together with their one child. Emiliana's most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her home structure. She is receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan. Emiliana would like to save her profits to start building her house

The three pictures taken in their community complete the group of 15 members.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Lorena es una señora trabajadora, humilde que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como es: enchiladas verdes, empanadas y sopes.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es cocinar y darles una buena atención a sus clientes.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Betoldino un señor trabajador que se dedica a la albañilería desde hace  tres años.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la  compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: chile, cebolla, ajo, jitomate, pollo y tortillas.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos una niña y un niña a quien quiere y por cual su esposo y ella trabajan día a día.
Gracias fundación por ayudar a las familias pobres.
texts.en: Lorena is a humble and a hard-working woman who makes a living selling traditional Mexican dishes like green enchiladas, empanadas and soups. She tells us that what she enjoys most about her business is cooking and providing good service to her customers. She has been happily married to Betoldino, who makes a living as a construction worker, for the past three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients to make her dishes: chili peppers, onion, garlic, tomatoes, chicken and tortillas. She has two children, a son and a daughter whom she loves and for whom she and her husband work for every day. She thanks Kiva and its partners for helping poor families.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Amigos Unidos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Sofia is the coordinator of her group Amigos Unidos 1, 2 & 3, which is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is a rural area surrounded by fields of sugarcane. Sofia runs a comedor (a little restaurant where neighbors and workers eat lunch) where people around her community buy her food. She started her business seven years ago. 

Sofia is a single mother of two children. Her most important challenges are to work hard to provide for her family and to help her children go forward in their studies. She is receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional and she is committed to working harder to improve her business. Sofia would like to save her profits to reinvest in her business. She wants to have a successful restaurant.

The 15 members of the group are shown in the three pictures taken in their community.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, meat, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 41 years old, is married and has 2 children. She lives in Ganase, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Josephine has operated a business selling ready-to-wear dresses for 3 years. She earns PHP 6,000 monthly. Josephine has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes for her clothing sales business. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes for her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 46 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 5 children. For the past 20 years, Judith has worked in the fish industry and sold fish for a living. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Judith has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El señor Abel es una persona que habla el idioma mixteco se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace ocho años, el nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es darle una buena atención a sus clientes para que ellos se sientan bien y le vuelvan a comprar.
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es: leche,manteca,cereales,acite,manteca,café,azúcar,frijol,jitomate,cebolla,ajos,verduras y productos enlatados.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarlo seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Abel is a person who speaks the mixteco language. He has been selling groceries for the past eight years. He reports that what he enjoys most about his business is that he provides good service for his customers, so that they feel welcome and return to his store.
He requested the loan in order to purchase more groceries such as milk, butter, cereals, olive oil, coffee, sugar, beans, tomatoes, onions, garlic, vegetables and canned goods.
He thanks the Fundación for helping him carry on with his business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for selling.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian was a manager in an auto store for five years before starting his own mechanic shop – Stripped Motorsports. Brian first demonstrated his entrepreneurial spirit three years prior by selling bike parts - acquired from Craigslist or auctions – to customers online or in his store. Eventually, Brian started selling new bikes and providing mechanic services such as oil changing. Along with managing the day-to-day in-store operations, Brian also spends a large portion of his time on the road.  He travels mainly through Oregon, Washington and California purchasing inventory. With limited amount of capital for these purchases, Brian needed assistance from a lender but did not have a long enough track record to work with a commercial bank. Brian needs a loan to be able to purchase bikes and bike parts to keep up with the growing demand from his clients.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Jay-Ann

texts.en:
Jay-ann is married with two children. Jay-ann is 24 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Jay-ann sells junk plastics, metal, and bronze to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase junk metals, plastics, and bronze to sell.
Jay-ann has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jay-ann hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  junk metals, plastics, and bronze to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, a resident of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental is a married woman who has four children. She is 45 years old. 

Elma's source of income comes from planting, harvesting, and selling corn in the local area. For 15 years, her business has been doing great, and she gains PHP 3,000 a month from it. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 20,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. 

She become a member of GDMPC in the year 1997. Positively, Elma hopes to make improvements to their living condition and finance the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase land.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor Gilberto es un señor trabajador, alegre que se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace tres años.
El nos cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio  por que le deja buenas ganancias y administra su tiempo y le da tiempo para estar con su familia.
El nos cuenta que va a las localidades a ofrecer su mercancía para  obtener mas ganancias y hacer crecer su negocio y que le frutos para el futuro.
El pidió el préstamo para comprar más  pescado como es: ti Chinda, jaiva, chuleta, pulpo, lisa, mojara prieta mojara blanco  y camarón  fresco.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a seguir con su negocio para seguir adelante.
texts.en: Gilberto is a hard-working, happy man who has made a living selling fish for the past three years. He tells us that he really enjoys his work because he makes good profits and it gives him time to be with his family. He goes to various communities to offer his products to maximize his profits and grow his business so it prospers in the future. He is requesting the loan to purchase more fresh fish and seafood (crab, octopus, shrimp). He thanks Kiva and the foundation for helping him to continue making progress with his business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and seafood to sell.

loans.name: Niket

texts.en: Niket established Brooklyn Bandit Jeans two years ago.  Brooklyn Bandit Jeans designs and produces its own label of men’s jeans and shirts and retails online and in stores across the country.  Niket buys the raw fabric from Manhattan in the fabric district and designs the jeans himself in his home.  He also employs the help of a tailor part-time who sews the jeans, in addition to hats and shirts.  Apparel offerings vary by season, and Nicket’s business occasionally sells accessories such as sunglasses.  Niket is looking for a loan that will help finance the cost of production for Brooklyn’s Bandit Jeans’ next season. A loan will help Niket cover these costs, as well as help to expand his online market presence.

loans.use: to cover the costs of producing his inventory and to expand his online market presence.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. 

Generosa owns and operates a business raising livestock and chickens for sale. Generosa has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Generosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Renan

texts.en: Renan immigrated to the US from Brazil many years ago to start his own small painting business in Framingham, Massachusetts. He started his business because he had extensive experience in the painting, renovation and repair industry and found that it was more profitable to work for himself than for a large company. Renan started very small and found his biggest challenge was acquiring his first clients. Renan found it was challenging to keep the business running early on but through self-determination and hard work he has grown his client-base and even recently launched his business web page (www.americanpaintingpro.com). Renan needed capital to expand his advertising budget but could not secure financing from a bank because his loam request was too small. With additional capital, Renan hopes to acquire new clients by expanding his advertising presence.

loans.use: To pay for advertising expenses

loans.name: Kirk

texts.en: Kirk owns and operates a mobile food truck - On the Move Coffee Café - a business that has been in operation since January 2011.  Her food truck offers beverages and small, pre-packaged food items in and around Round Hill, Virginia, often catering to special events throughout the area. Kirk's business has also been invited to sell at baseball fields, picnics and company events.  Kirk needs a loan to be able to purchase a natural gas truck generator as her current gasoline generator is not cost-effective to maintain and is noisy and disruptive for certain events. With capital, Kirk will be able to purchase a new natural gas truck generator which will open the door for future business growth.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas truck generator

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 25 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Jenifer is married with one child. 
Jenifer has a store that sells a variety of products. Jenifer has had this business for three years. Jenifer requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
Jenifer has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jenifer hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 32 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy dinámica. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Lo más desea es ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos. El trabajo de Carmen consiste en la venta de ropa, desde hace cinco años que emprendió éste negocio debido a que su situación economía era precaria, por lo que tomó valor para salir adelante. Es así que la mercadería lo adquirió en la ciudad de Lima, pues el precio de la ropa era más cómoda. Sus primeras ventas lo hicieron con vecinos y amistades, pero con el pasar del tiempo logró consolidarse y ahora vende en grandes cantidades entre sus amigas, familia y personas nuevas que van en busca de una prenda de buena calidad y sobre todo de un buen precio. Trabaja sola y está muy contenta ya que le genera buenas ganancias con lo cual puede aportar en la economía de su hogar. Su plan es  ampliar su negocio. Este será el sexto cerdito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar mas tranquila y avanzar con sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ropa y más accesorios femeninos para continuar con su trabajo y seguir ofreciendo novedades a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32. She is a good woman; friendly and very dynamic. She lives with her partner, and they have three children. They live together in their own house. Her greatest desire is to provide her children with a good education. 

Carmen works selling clothing. She launched this business five years go because her financial situation was precarious, so it took courage to move forward. So it was that she acquired the merchandise in the city of Lima, as the price of clothing was more affordable.

She made her first sales to neighbors and friends, but as time went on, she managed to build up her business. She now sells in large quantities among her friends, family, and new customers who seek a good quality article of clothing, and especially one at a good price. 

She works alone, and is very happy, as she makes good profits which enable her to contribute to the household finances. Her plan is to expand her business. 

This will be her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support, as this will allow her breathe easier, and go forward with her plans. In addition, she promises to pay her installments on time, and especially, to have a good relationship with the members of her communal bank, who are very supportive.  

With the amount of 2,500 soles applied for, she will buy clothing and more women's accessories to continue with her business, and keep offering new styles to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida moved to the United States 10 years ago to find a job that would afford her more economic opportunity in life. The Brazilian native found a job doing what she knew best – working in the beauty industry, styling nails, hair, and giving facials. In order to be able to provide beauty services for clients in her home, Brigida needed capital upfront to purchase supplies and equipment. As an immigrant, Brigida had difficulty finding a loan because she did not have a credit history. In addition, Brigida had paid all of her bills in cash. Without a history of credit, no bank was able to give her a loan. Through the Brazilian Community Center in Deerfield Beach, FL, Brigida learned from the Brazilian Small Business Networking Event hosted in Portuguese that there was capital available for small business owners in Miami, Florida.  With a loan, Brigida will be able to purchase beauty supplies. With additional capital, Brigida will be able to build her future and build her business up to a full service salon.

loans.use: to purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie, a 53-year-old woman, is married and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Josie, at her age, still manages their business in the agriculture sector, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. It's been 10 years since she started their business. She earns PHP 4,000 a month. Since she needs to purchase additional fertilizer such as manure, she requested a loan of PHP 7,000. She become a member of GDMPC in the year 2010. With courage, she expects to reap a good harvest. Her plan is to finance and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is 63 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with four children.

To earn a living, Praxedes has a business selling a variety of foods. He earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Praxedes has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for his snack vending business.

Praxedes has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Praxedes would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for his snack vending business

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben, 29, is single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ruben's business is successful. He used his last loan to procure charcoal-making materials. Now he is taking a new loan, which will be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. Ruben hopes to be able to double the profit he gets from the business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells to make charcoal

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Maria de Guadalupe va a comprar con su prestamo leña, la sñora Ubalda va a comprar dulces, las otras integrantes siguen en su actividad que viene desarrollando. La señora Ubalda tiene 77 años de edad, ella es casada, su esposo ya esta grande y no trabaja está enfermo, ella tiene 13 hijos 8 varones y 5 mujeres, todos mayores de edad, ella tiene su puesto de dulces, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar dulces paletas de caramelo mazapán, chicles, chocolates, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años pensó en hacer algo y estar ocupada, su negocio es importante porque obtiene ingresos para ir comiendo y para seguir invirtiendo, a ella le gusta vender los dulce con los niños los aprecia, su negocio es conocido por la atención que le tiene a sus clientes, ella está feliz con este préstamo lo va a utilizar par comprar dulces para ampliar su negocio , ella utiliza las ganancias para comer y para comprar dulces de diferentes sabores. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que todos estén bien de salud, que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Las integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos y estamos felices de que nos están apoyando con sus préstamos a crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en: The newest members of the group are Maria de Guadalupe, who plans to use the loan to purchase firewood, and Ubalda, who is going to purchase candies. The other members continue developing their activities. Ubalda is 77 years old and married. Her husband is sick and doesn't work. She has 13 children, eight boys and five girls, all of whom are grown up. Ubalda has a post selling candy and is requesting the loan to purchase lollipops, caramels, marzipan, gum and chocolates. She started her business 10 years ago because she wanted to do something and keep busy. Her business is important because it raises revenue so she can keep eating and investing. She enjoys selling candy because children appreciate it, and her sales post is known for its customer service. Ubalda is happy about the loan and plans to use it to purchase candies to expand her business. She uses her profits for sustenance and to reinvest in candies of different flavors. Her hopes and dreams are for everyone to stay in good health and for her children to lack nothing. The group members thank Kiva and partner Fundación Realidad for the loans and say "We are happy that you are supporting us with the loans to grow our businesses."

loans.use: to purchase lollipops, candies, gum, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Srei

texts.en:
Mrs. Srei is a pig-raiser as well as a Khmer traditional wine distiller, who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She makes most of her income from the two businesses. She generates approximately $3.60 per day to support her family. She is now 44 years old and has been blessed with four single children who are attending public school in the province. 

Srei will add this loan from HKL and Kiva to her savings to purchase a plot of land which can be used to build a new house for one of her children someday after they are married. She is really a good mother who always cares very much about her children’s future and education. She is very thankful to the lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Neciforo

texts.en: Neciforo is from Labuyo Tangub City. He is 59 years old. Neciforo is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Neciforo raises livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. He has been engaged in his business for 16 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Neciforo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Rosalinda is married and has five children. 

To make a living, Rosalinda works in a family member's banana and coconut business venture. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 3,305 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is forty-nine years of age and is married with five children.

Maria owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Maria needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Maria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Maria's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy harvesting equipment

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is from Gala, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has seven children. Alejandra owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is twenty-two years of age and is married with two children.  Emi  owns & operates a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Emi  needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2009, Emi  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Emi 's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is married and has one child. She is 54 years old and resides at Montol, Ozamis City, Philippines. Arsenia makes and sells bamboo sticks which are used in preparing barbecue. She's been in this business for five years, earning 3,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP in order to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. In 2010, Arsenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Arsenia wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Faavae

texts.en:
Faavae is forty-one years of age and is married with four children.  Faavae owns & operates a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.   

Faavae needs a loan of  2,500 WST to repair a transport vehicle used in her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to supplement her family's income.

Faavae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Faavae's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her snacks business

loans.name: Fonotele

texts.en:
Fonotele is twenty-nine years of age and is married with three children.  Fonotele owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Fonotele needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Fonotele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Fonotele's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
This is Ronald, 32, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Helen, a housewife and mother to their only child. Ronald, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ronald operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Ronald's for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Ronald's regular customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund to buy recyclable materials from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Ronald hopes his business grows more in the coming years. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase scrap materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is a married woman with four children. She is 34 years old and resides at Montol, Ozamis City, Philippines. Marlyn plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Marlyn joined GDMPC in 2010 in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Marlyn wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Pasikalia

texts.en:
Pasikalia is fifty-seven years old.  She is married and has five children.   Pasikalia owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.    

Pasikalia needs a loan of 2,500 WST to rent land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Pasikalia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Pasikalia's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: rent land to raise crops

loans.name: Democrito

texts.en:
Democrito is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children.   Democrito  has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. He has had this business for 13 years. 

Democrito has requested a loan for 16,000 to buy coconuts to sell.  He has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010.  In the future, Democrito  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy coconuts

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
