But her hobby is taking care of her animals, cows and calves; this is how she relaxes and amuses herself.  When the cows produce milk she also makes cheese.  Marcelina is a woman who is always busy.

She belongs to the “Los Pioneros de Cumutay” (Cumutay Pioneers) and this will be MFP loan #10.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue toward her objectives.  She commits to punctually make her installment payments.  She will use the money to buy sacks of manure for her potato crops and a sack of pea seeds to plant a new crop.

loans.use: to buy a sack of manure and a sack of pea seeds.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de queso ella lo vende a sus clientes que le solicitan en Cusco y Mollepata,la socia a la vez se dedica a la ganaderia (vacas) las cuales las vende en ferias ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su famlia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas quesos para asi tener mas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gregoria alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling cheese.  She sells to customers who ask for her products in Cusco and Mollepata.  At the same time she devotes herself to livestock (cows).  She sells them at fairs.  She has been in this business for years.  It is through the business that she gets her family ahead.  She is a very happy and responsible person with a great desire to get her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy more cheese.  That way she will have more to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cheese in order to have more to offer her customers.

loans.name: Maria Doly

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos, 01 de ellos en etapa escolar. Hace más de 10 años que María se dedica a la venta de comidas  la cual trabaja a repartos. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo María ha mejorado su vivienda y ayudado en la educación de sus hijos. Los ingresos que recibe son de mucha ayuda para ella, ya que puede seguir apoyando en su hogar.  María tiene como meta terminar de construir su vivienda. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite entre otros productos para la preparación de sus comidas. María agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por hacer posible su progreso.
texts.en: María is a hard-working 45-year-old who lives with her partner and two children, one of whom is school-aged. She has sold food and delivered it for over ten years. With hard work, Maria has been able to improve her home and support her children's education. Her income is a great help for her, because she is able to help with the household costs. Maria's goal is to finish building her home. She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil, and other products for making food. Maria would like to thank all of the Kiva lenders for making this possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta and oil.

loans.name: Olga Carmen

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 19 y 12 años, a los cuales ha criado y saca adelante junto a su pareja; Olga como buena peruana ama nuestra comida y uno de sus platos favoritos es la Carapulcra; Doris estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria debido a que sus padres no tenían los recursos suficientes, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Economía.

Olga tiene un auto, como Olga no sabe conducir el auto su pareja es quien lo trabaja, labora alrededor de 8 horas y puede atender hasta 30 clientes de manera diaria, pero Olga con el fin de apoyar a su pareja en los gastos, trabaja en un fundo, con ello ambos aportan con los gastos del hogar  y las necesidades primordiales, ella cree que a su pareja le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque es honrado.

Olga está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrán realizarle un mantenimiento al vehículo así como también reparar algunos desperfectos, con ello mejorara sus ingresos ya que tendrán un vehículo en buenas condiciones y los clientes se sentirán mas seguros, con ello seguirá ahorrando para así poder cumplir su gran sueño: “Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Olga is a 50-year-old woman. She has two children ages 19 and 12, whom she has raised with her partner. Olga, like a good Peruvian housewife, loves Peruvian food. One of her favourite dishes is Carapulcra. Doris studied until the fifth grade of secondary school, because her parents did not have enough resources. She would have liked to study economics.
Olga has one car. Because she does not know how to drive, her husband works with the car. He works about eight hours per day, serving up to 30 clients. Because Olga's goal is to support her partner with their costs, she works on an estate. This way, they both contribute to paying the household costs and buying the basic staples. Olga thinks that the business is going very well for her husband because he is very kind to the customers, and he is very honest.
Olga is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to your help she and her partner will be able to perform vehicle maintenance and repair some issues. This will improve their income, because they will have a vehicle in good condition and the clients will feel more secure. She will continue to save up in order to fulfill her greatest dream: "To allow my children to become professionals."

loans.use: with vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboracion de quesos para luego venderlo en un mercado por el centro de la ciudad solo los dias sabados de feria,la socia a la vez se dedica a la ganaderia ella tiene vacas las cuales las cria para venderlas a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia tambien se dedica a la agricultura sembrando papa y maiz que tambien los vende en las ferias y clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar quesos.
texts.en:
This member is Gregoria.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business.  Her business is making cheese which she then sells in a market in the city center.  She only sells her products on Saturday market days.  She also raises livestock.  She has cows which she raises and then sells to customers who request them.  Gregoria also farms.  She grows potatoes and corn which she sells at market and to customers who request them.  Gregoria is a very cheerful and responsible person who has a great desire to provide for her family.

The member is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making cheese.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making cheese

loans.name: Marta Idania

texts.es:
Marta Idania, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, con 3 hijos de 12, 8, y 2 años de edad, vive en Omoa, cortes.
Marta es muy trabajadora, ella inicio su propia actividad de negocio, con fondos propios, hace 6 años comenzó vendiendo mercadería como productos escolares, de limpieza para el hogar, pastas dental, lociones y otros. Luego agrego otros productos (chiclera), como ser confites, churros, etc. Este negocio le deja buenas ganancias ya que hay muchos niños que lo consumen y vende bastante.
Ha venido surtiendo poco a poco con sus ganancias y con los préstamos obtenidos. Este préstamo que solicita es el segundo y va a surtir de churros, confites, y útiles escolares.
La idea es ampliar el negocio, mantener surtido y obtener mejores ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades familiares
texts.en:
Marta Idania, age 30, is married and has three children, ages 12, 8, and 2.  She lives in Omoa, Cortes.

Marta is a very hard-worker.  She started her own business activity with her own funds six years ago.  She started selling merchandise like school supplies, home cleaning products, toothpaste, lotions, and others.  Then she added other products (gum and snacks) like candy, and churros, etc.  This business produces good income because there are a lot of children who consume these products, and she sells plenty of them.

With her earnings and the loans she has gotten she has been slowly stocking the business.  This loan that she is requesting is the second one.  She will stock up on churros, candy, and school supplies.  The idea is to expand the business, to keep it stocked, and to get improved income to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy churros, candy, and school supplies.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La socia continua administrando de su flota de combis y es empresaria a tiempo completo; la socia desea comprar un par mas de unidades poco a poco y seguir prosperando para apoyar a su familia y brindarles mejor calidad de vida, la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de sus unidades vehiculares para que sigan operando con normalidad.
texts.en: Marisol continues to run her fleet of minibuses. She is a full-time businesswoman. The member wants to purchase 2 more units little by little. She also wants to continue prospering in order to support her family and give them a better quality of life. The member is requesting a loan to invest in the maintenance of her vehicle units in order to keep them running normally.

loans.use: invest in the maintenance of her vehicles.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El socio anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de artesania,pero no le fue muy bien en este negocio,ahora el socio se esta dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es mejorar el negocio de servicio de taxi.La socia solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos para su carro.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jhon used to sell handicrafts, but it did not go very well for him. He now provides a taxi service. He has a car and offers transportation throughout Cusco. He works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm, and through this business he is able to get his children ahead. His dream is to improve his taxi business. He is requesting this loan for car maintenance and to buy spare parts.
He is happy to have this loan and promises to repay his quotas.

loans.use: to maintain his car and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La socia continua atendiendo su pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa, la socia cuida y atiende a su ultimo hijo y a sus nietitos, ella como cada prestamo invierte en la comprar de productos de primera necesidad que salen a diario, como azucar, arroz, fideos, harinas, leche entre otros.  La socia desea invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor.
texts.en: This member continues to run her small grocery store out of her home.  She also cares for her youngest child and her young grandchildren.  As with her previous loans, she will invest the loan in the purchase of basic necessity products that she sells daily such as sugar, rice, noodles, flour, milk, etc.  She wants to invest in the purchase these products wholesale.

loans.use: purchase basic necessity products wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Simforiana

texts.en:
45-year-old Simforiana is a married woman with six children aged between five and twenty-three years old.  Simforiana and her husband are both farmers. They own and till land in Trinidad, Bohol. Simforiana's husband mainly manages their rice farm. Simforiana does her best to support her husband in keeping their crops healthy and their farm free of weeds and pests. She also makes sure to take care of her children.

Simforiana has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She hopes to have successful children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem is a 39-year-old married woman who has been residing in Kompong Cham province. Soem has been operating a fruit-selling business in front of her house besides working on her rice field. She decided to run this business because her present house is located along a national road, on which people travel back and forth every day. She sells fruit such as jackfruits, bananas, coconuts and custard-apples to those travellers. From this business, she is able to earn approximately $5.00 per day.

Soem is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to pay for the fruit, which she has bought from her frequent suppliers. This loan will contribute to the development of her business. She is very grateful for the generous funds given to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for the fruit, which she has bought from her frequent suppliers.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
Venancio is a 42-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with two children aged six and seven.

Venancio has been working as a fisherman for ten years. His wife sells his catch at the market. Venancio said he and his wife both work hard to achieve their dreams for their family.

Venancio has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, bait and other materials. Venancio hopes to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, bait and other materials.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 37-year-old married woman with six children who are enrolled in school. Her husband Juma is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated a food stall for the past year; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase more beans, rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more beans, rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial, tiene 34 años, Susana tiene un ferretería, no tiene hijos, y es soltera, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año, en el tiempo que esta aquí se siente muy bien porque ve que sus ahorros están creciendo, las capacitaciones le ayudan en su vida personal, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fierros.
texts.en: Susana is a member of the communal bank Manantial.  She is 34 years old and has a hardware store.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  She has been a member of Finca Perú for 1 year. She feels very good about the time that she has been here because she is seeing her savings grow.  The training sessions have helped her in her personal life.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy hardware.

loans.use: purchase hardware for her store.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en: Matiya is a 22-year-old hardworking man living in Hioma, Uganda. For five years he has been involved in farming in order to support his parents. His major challenge is the unpredictable seasonal weather. His dream is to venture into mechanized and modernized agricultural practices. Matiya intends to use the loan to pay workers who are digging his fields.

loans.use: to pay workers who are digging his fields

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de 3 enfants dont 1 élève.Il est pisciniste de formation .Il gère une entreprise de réalisation et d'entretien de piscine. Pour améliorer ses revenus, il mène en meme temps un commerce de tissus qu'il importe d'un pays limitrophe.Il place ses marchandises auprès des détaullants et des boutiquiers de sa localité qui lui paient au bout d'un mois. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 500000f pour acheter 47 coupons  de tissus bazin. Son ambition est d'élagir son commerce.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married man and the father of three children, one of whom is a student. The borrower manages an enterprise for building and maintaining swimming pools. To improve his revenues, he runs a business at the same time selling fabrics he imports from a neighboring country. He fills orders for retailers and shopkeepers in his town who then pay him at the end of the month. 

To increase his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC in order to buy 47 cuts of damask cloth. His ambition is to expand his commerce.

loans.use: to buy 47 cuts of damask cloth

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de pintura,ella junto con su esposo realizan trabajos en pintura y luego los vende a las diferentes tiendas que venden pinturas,la socia tarbaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de pintura.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como pinturas,pinceles y papeles al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rita is still running her painting business. She and her husband paint and then sell their work to the various stores that sell paintings. Rita works from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm. Through this business, she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand her painting business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials such as paint, paint brushes and paper wholesale.
She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas.

loans.use: to buy materials such as paint, paint brushes and paper wholesale.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Doña Dora, sigue con sus ventas ambulante y en su casa de habitacion, desde horas temprana vende su rico y caliente café, café de leche, pan con mantequilla, hace pequeños desayunos como: gallo pinto, con queso, enchiladas, lo que apoya  a su familia  al poder tener mejores ventas, su esposo labora como albañil, y sus hijos estudian.
Con este nuevo prestamo, podra comprar, mas productos en café, presto, cremora, azucar, pan, mantequilla y mucha leña para seguir vendiendo y poder ganar para una mejor alimentacion de su familia.
texts.en: Doña Dora continues her street sales and her sales from her home. Starting early in the morning she sells her rich, hot coffee, coffee with milk, bread with butter and she makes small breakfasts such as beans and rice with cheese and enchiladas which support her family with better sales. Her husband works as a bricklayer and her children go to school.  With this new loan she will be able to buy more coffee products such as coffee, creamer, sugar, bread, butter and a lot of firewood to continue selling and bringing in an income to better feed her family.

loans.use: purchase coffee, creamer, sugar, bread, butter and firewood.

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.ru: Бахридин проживает в районе Кубодиён. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Бахридин уже три года как занимается скотоводством. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Bahridin lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education.  Bahridin has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial, tiene 28 años. Yanet vende frutas en las ferias, es madre de 4 hijos, y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años. Yanet siente que si ha progresado, gracias a los préstamos recibidos se pudo comprar una moto, recuerda que hace años empezó su negocio con muy poco capital, desde que entro a Finca Perú es mas responsable y ha progresado mas rápido, esta muy agradecida por las enseñanzas que le dieron ya que le sirvieron para tener un buen negocio, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la construcción de su casa.
texts.en: Yanet is a member of the communal bank Mantanial. She is 28 years old. Yanet sells fruit in the market. She is the mother of four children, and she has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years. Yanet feels that she has progressed thanks to the loans she has received. She was able to purchase a motorcycle. She recalls that she began her business years ago with very little capital. Since she joined Finca, she has been more responsible and has progressed more rapidly. She is very thankful for the classes they give, since they help her to have a good business. Now she will invest her loan in the construction of her house.

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia es una emprendedora que ha luchado por salir adelante  con su negocio. Ella ya es clienta de Fundación León 2000, no es la primera vez que está solicitando financiamiento ya tiene varios ciclos en cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un excelente récord crediticio. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de capital trabajo en la que comprara cal, maíz, leña, comal, bolsas plásticas, entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa Amelia is an entrepreneur who has worked hard to advance with her business. She is already a client of Fundación León 2000. This is not the first time she has applied for  financing, since she has had various loan cycles in which she has demonstrated that she is a responsible person and has an excellent credit record. Now she is applying for financing for working capital, with which she will buy lime, corn, firewood, a comal (a frying pan for making tortillas), plastic bags, and other items.

loans.use: to buy lime, corn, firewood, a coma, and plastic bags, among other items.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea, 52, resident of Biga, Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ignacio, a farmer, and a mother to their children, together with her husband they manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Irenea operates a market stall. She sells vegetables, raw products and condiment items in the community market. She buys quantities of vegetable products and other common items used in cooking and sell them by the kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more vegetable products and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Irenea hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and cooking products needed in her business.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine needs a loan to buy fish to sell.  The forty-eight-year-old, married man lives in Hioma, Uganda and has been in the fish business for twenty years.  He faces the challenge of seasonal weather changes which leads to the price fluctuation of fish.  His family dream is to build a permanent house and his business dream is to own a fishing boat at the fishing ground.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Treng

texts.en:
Mrs. Treng is 45 years old and has seven children. Two of her sons work as laborers in the neighbouring country and send a part of their salaries to help the family every month. To generate income, Treng works at rice husbandry in Kompong Cham province, where she presently lives with her husband and her five other children. She is able to make around $2.50 per day to satisfy her daily needs.

With a loan of $1,200, Treng will buy a used motorcycle for the whole family’s use as well as for one of her sons to provide motor-taxi service around the province. In the future, she hopes to improve her farming business by expanding her existing farmland.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas, tiene 55 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, para ella la ayuda que le da Finca tiene mucho valor porque cada vez que saca los préstamos le enseñan a invertir bien y no lo malgasta, en el tiempo que esta en Finca aprendió a ser mas responsable y la puntualidad, gracias a ello se pudo compra su refrigeradora y demás artefactos, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios.
texts.en: Marina is a member of the communal bank Golondrinas (Swallows). She is 55 years old and sells food. She is the mother of four children. She is married, and she has been a member of Finca Perú for three years. For her, the help that Finca gives her has great value, because every time she takes out a loan they teach her to invest well and not waste it. In the time she has been in Finca, she learned to be more responsible and punctual. Thanks to this, she was able to buy a refrigerator and other appliances. Now she will invest the loan she is applying for in the purchase of cooking utensils.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas, tiene 40 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es madre de 2 hijos y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones que le ayudan con la crianza de sus hijos, los préstamos le ayudan a tener mas ganas de progresar porque cada vez saca mas semilla y así puede crecer cada vez mas, ahora con el préstamo que recibirá lo invertirá en la compra de ropa.
texts.en: Alicia is a member of the communal bank Las Golondrinas (The Swallows). She is 40 years old. She works in clothing sales. She is the mother of two children, and she has been a member of Finca Perú for 3 years. What she likes most is the training, which helps her raise her children. The loans help her to have more will to progress, because every time she takes out more seed (money), and thus she can grow each time. Now she will invest the loan that she will receive in the purchase of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy various clothing for the season

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 35-year-old married woman with three children who are enrolled in school. Her husband, Hamisi, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family

Catherine has operated a nursery and primary school for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers’ children. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of textbooks, chairs, desks, tables, and stationery for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase textbooks, chairs, desks, tables, and stationery for her business.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel, a 43-year-old married father of four children, works hard to provide for his family. For the past 26 years, he has worked in auto repair, specializing in body repair and painting. His previous loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua helped a lot in improving his business through the purchase of new tools and machines. 

Kamel is now requesting a new loan in order to register a van he bought to transport products he needs in his two businesses, his latest one a household appliances shop he just started to increase his income to cover his family's expenses. The van will be used to transport the household appliances from the dealerto his shop.

He hopes to expand both businesses as much as he can, to make sure his family's needs are all covered.

loans.use: to register a van he bought for his business.

loans.name: Fazlidin

texts.ru: Фазлидин проживает в районе Кубодиён. Ему 63 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Фазлидин имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности он фармацевт. У него имеется аптека, где он уже 25 лет занимается торговлей медикаментов. Он берет кредит для приобретения необходимых препаратов.
texts.en: Fazlidin lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 63 years old, married and has six children.  His son is working in the Russian Federation.  Fazlidin has a secondary-specialized education.  He is a pharmacist.  He has a pharmacy, where has been selling medicines for over 25 years.  Fazlidin is requesting this loan to purchase necessary medicines.

loans.use: to purchase necessary medicines

loans.name: 6 Rosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario de las 6 Rosas se formo en el municipio de García, Nuevo León, al oriente de la ciudad de Monterrey. El grupo esta formado por 6 mujeres y decidieron ponerse este nombre, ya que dicen que son como 6 delicadas y hermosas rosas. Todas las integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras y se dedican a diferentes oficios como la venta de ropa, joyería, zapatos, y diferentes tipos de alimentos como snacks y taquitos.

Karla Elizabeth es una joven integrante de 27 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. El mayor se llama Guillermo y a sus 11 años esta terminando de estudiar la primaria, mientras Mariana, la menor, apenas tiene 2 años y el próximo año espera entrar al kinder.

Karla hace poco más de 1 año se dió cuenta de la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, así es que tomó la decisión de poner un pequeño puesto comidas. Karla esta teniendo mucho éxito con sus tacos, así es que decidió sacar un crédito para hacer crecer un poco más sus ventas  y mejorar su negocio para que sus clientes sientan mas comodos.

Uno de los sueños mas anhelados por Karla es que algun día, no muy lejano, pueda poner una taquería que le genere suficientes ingresos para poporcionarle una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “6 Rosas” (6 Roses) is in the municipality of García, Nuevo León, to the east of the city of Monterrey. The group is made up of 6 women, and they decided to choose this number since they say that they are list 6 delicate and beautiful roses. All of the members of this group are very hardworking women, and they work in different sales businesses like clothing, jewelry, shoes, and different types of food like snacks and taquitos. 

Karla Elizabeth is a young 27 year old borrower. She’s married and has two children. The oldest is named Guillermo, and at 11 years old he’s finishing primary school. Meanwhile, Mariana, the youngest, is only 2 years old, and next year she’ll start kindergarten.  

A little more than one year ago Karla realized that she needed to help her husband with the household costs. That’s how she came to the decision to open a little food stand. Karla’s having a lot of success with her tacos. So she decided to get a loan to increase her sales a bit more and improve her business so that her customers feel more comfortable. 

One of Karla’s most cherished dreams is that one day, not too far off, she can have a little restaurant that brings her enough income to provider her and her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock a greater variety of merchandise for her snack stand.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima Del Carmen es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio de la venta de mercadería en general con fondos propio esta idea surge de la necesidad de generar ingresos para la familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante brindándole lo necesario. Ella no es la primera vez que está solicitando financiamiento para el negocio, nos cuenta que está muy bien con el negocio sus clientes la visitan más  seguido por la variedad de productos que le ofrece, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar toallas, ropa, calzado y otros productos que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en: Fátima Del Carmen is an enterprising woman who used her own funds to start her general merchandise sales business.  This idea arose from a need to generate income for the family and give her children what they need to get ahead.  This is not the first time she is requesting funding for the business.  She tells us that she is doing well with the business as customers visit her often because of the variety of products she offers.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase towels, clothing, footwear and other products that her customers request.  .

loans.use: to purchase towels, clothing, footwear and other products.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 51-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of three children. Khetam started her business by selling perfumes; then she expanded to sell accessories, medals and makeup which she imports from Dubai, China and Aqaba (a special economical zone in Jordan). 

Khetam is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian dinars to purchase perfumes and accessories for trading purposes. She is looking to expand her business by networking with other clients through the internet and friends.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and accessories for trading purposes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old married man from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan and a father of eight children.

Ali is a mechanic and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase new equipment for his shop.

Ali is looking to expand his shop so that he can absorb the increased number of clients with an aspiration to improve his family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase new equipments for his shop

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas, tiene 58 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes que trae de la chacra, es divorciada y madre de 5 hijos, ella siempre se esforzó por seguir adelante, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, esta muy bien en Finca, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a progresar y le enseñan a seguir mejorando en su vida personal como en su negocio. Ahora con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de abarrotes al por mayor.
texts.en: Maximiliana is a member of 'Las Golondrinas' community bank.  She is 58 years old and sells groceries that she gets from the farm.  She is divorced and has five children.  Maximiliana always works hard in order to get ahead in life.  She has been a member of Finca Peru for three years.  She is very happy to belong to Finca.  She loves the training sessions because they help her to make progress and they teach her to continue improving both in her personal life and in her business.  She will use the loan that she has requested to invest in buying groceries wholesale.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es: Maria Vilma tiene 62 años de edad, la actividad a la que se dedica es al destace de cerdo en el cual este negocio lo aprendió por un familiar que le enseño el negocio. Además se inicia  de la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia y sacar a su hijo adelante. Maria Vilma es una emprendedora que toda la vida ha sabido salir adelante, ella está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra cerdos.
texts.en: María Vilma is 62 years old and her activity is butchering pigs, a business she learned from a family member who taught it to her.  She went into this business in because she needed to generate family income and support her son.  María Vilma is an entrepreneur who has known how to get ahead her entire life.  She’s asking for a loan to invest in her business buying pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne forma parte del Banco comunal “Levántate y Crece” perteneciente a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al oficio de la confección de cortinaje desde hace 6 años. Ha realizado cursos de perfeccionamiento en diferentes institutos.
Sus insumos los compra en la comuna de Independencia, perteneciente a la ciudad de Santiago.
Trabaja desde su casa en un taller que habilitó en uno de los dormitorios. Comenta además que recibe ayuda de otra persona, tres veces a la semana cuando debe entregar una mayor cantidad de productos.
Con el crédito comprará una máquina de coser industrial, trabaja con empresas y tiendas de tela, en la confección de cortinaje.
Sus metas son expandir su negocio.
Ivonne vive junto a sus tres hijos de 27, 21 y 8 años de edad, el mayor de ellos trabaja y estudia. Uno de sus sueños es poder independizarse y contar con su propio taller.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad de Fondo esperanza por el crédito obtenido, ya que de esta manera podrá invertir en su negocio.
El grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy comprometido, además existe mucha confianza y apoyo entre sus integrantes.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para mejorar la contabilidad de su negocio.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agro frutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a member of “Levántate y Crece” community bank which is located in the town of Rancagua.  She has been in business making drapes for six years.  She has attended advanced courses in different institutes.  She buys her supplies in Independencia, in the city of Santiago.

Ivonne works from home, in a workshop that she set up in one of her bedrooms.  She says that she has help from another person, three times a week, when she must deliver a larger quantity of products.

Ivonne will use her loan to buy an industrial sewing machine.  She works with fabric companies and stores, making drapes.  Her goal is to expand her business.

Ivonne lives together with her three children who are 27, 21 and 8 years old.  Her eldest works and studies.  One of her dreams is to start working for herself and to own her own workshop.

Ivonne is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she is receiving from Fondo Esperanza through this loan as it will enable her to invest in her business.

The community bank to which Ivonne belongs is very committed.  There is a lot of trust and support between its members.  The training sessions have helped Ivonne to improve her business accounts.

Rancagua is located in Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region.  It is a modern town which controls Chile's production and export of food, fruit and wine.  It is also a mining town and its mountain range is home to the largest underground mine in the world (El Teniente), which has 4,500km of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cocachacra” es un grupo conformado por 07 personas empeñosas y responsables comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad, siendo Mercedes una de las socias, ella tiene 55 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Mercedes cuenta con una bodega, lleva en este negocio más de 15 años, lo que pudo ahorrar y con la ayuda de su esposo pudo comprarse un carro la cual  brinda servicio de transporte. El deseo de Mercedes es de comprarse otro carro, para que lo alquile como servicio de transporte. El  crédito lo utilizara para comprar gaseosas, agua mineral, cervezas, galletas, chocolates, entre otros, y de esta manera tener surtida su bodega. La Alcancía Comunal “Santa Cruz de Cocachacra” están muy agradecidos con el crédito brindado.  La Sra. Mercedes es la primera del lado derecho viste una casaca marón y pantalón negro. En el desembolso Jorge asistió con su conviviente y su hijo podemos verlo en la fotografía, viste una polo amarillo.
texts.en:
The “Santa Cruz de Cocachacra” communal bank is composed of 7 determined, responsible people committed with Programa-Prosperidad.  Mercedes is one of the members.  She’s 55 years old, married and has three independent children.

Mercedes has a store that she’s operated for more than 15 years.  With savings she managed to accumulate and with help from her husband she was able to buy a car that provides transportation services.   Mercedes wants to buy another car to lease out for transportation services.  She will use the loan to buy soft-drinks, mineral water, beer, cookies and chocolates, among others to stock her store.

The “Santa Cruz de Cocachacra” communal bank is very grateful for the loan granted.  Mercedes is the first one on the right wearing a brown jacket and black pants.  At this payout, Jorge attended with his spouse and son.  In the photo he’s wearing a yellow t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, mineral water, beer, cookies and chocolates.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa en una joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por la hospitalidad de sus pobladores, sus playas hermosísimas y por la rica comida, así como también por ser considerada la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano. Rosa en sus tiempos libres disfruta e escuchar música y es que ella nos comenta que la música es lo que la ayuda a relajarse cuando esta preocupada o esta molesta; a Roa le gusta mucho la comida y es por ello que su plato favorito es la riquísima Carapulcra con sopa seca; por los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres rosa solo pudo estudiar hasta quinto grado de secundaria.

Rosa trabaja en su bodega, en la cual vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 25 clientes al día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicada y responsable así como también por su honradez y la calidad de los productos que ofrece.

Rosa está muy contenta y agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar mercadería al pro mayor y con ello podrá adquirir los productos que ofrece con un precio mas cómodo y asi poder tener mayores ingresos y variedad de productos que ofrecer a los clientes, con ello seguirá ahorrando y asi poder cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener una Gran Tienda”
texts.en:
Rosa, 21, is a young woman living in the city of Chincha, a city noted for the hospitality of its residents, its beautiful beaches and delicious cuisine as well as being the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  In her free time, Rosa enjoys listening to music because she comments that music helps her relax when she’s worried or upset.  Rosa likes food very much and her favorite dish is the very delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca.” Because of her parents’ limited economic resources Rosa was only able to study up to fifth grade of secondary school.

Rosa works in her store selling groceries and basic staple items.  She spends about 10 hours per day in her store and can take care of up to 25 customers daily.  She believes that she does well in business because she’s very dedicated and responsible and also because of her honesty and the quality of the products she offers.

Rosa is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders because with the help provided she will be able to buy merchandise at wholesale so will get the products she sells at a more affordable price thus leading to higher profits and more variety of products to offer customers.  With that, she will continue saving to reach her great dream: “To have a great store.”

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge con su credikiva anterior compró ranchos, víveres, abarrotes y bebidas, con las que surtió su negocio y lo ha ido convirtiendo en tienda poco a poco, porque le genera mayor rentabilidad y una mejor rotación de inventarios. En la actualidad planea inyectar una vez mas su capital de trabajo al negocio, comprando nuevamente víveres, abarrotes, enlatados y mercancías de miscelánea, aprovechando que son los productos de mayor salida en la época del fin de año, en la cual las familias consumen mucho mas, porque hay mas dinero en el ambiente pues los empleados de empresas reciben primas, bonificaciones y aguinaldos, que mueven la economía informal. Esta es justamente la razón de acceder a un credikiva nuevamente, para aumentar su capital de trabajo y lograr sostener un buen surtido y lograr el posicionamiento de su negocio, porque en él,  la gente encuentra todo lo que le hace falta y necesita.
texts.en:
Jorge used his Kiva loan to buy snacks, foodstuffs, groceries and beverages to stock his store; he invested it gradually because by better rotating stock he earns higher profits.  At present, he plans to inject working capital into the business again buying foodstuffs, groceries, canned goods and miscellaneous merchandise which are the best-selling items at the end of the year when families consume much more because there is more cash available because employees in firms receive bonuses, allowances and gifts that move the informal economy.

This is precisely why he’s accessing a Kiva loan again, to increase working capital and acquire a good assortment of stock to better position is store because people find in it everything they need and want.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas y muñecas,ella hace las muñecas y luego los reparte a las diferentes tiendas donde venden artesania,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que haga las muñecas como telas,lanas y pinturas al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues selling crafts; she sells sweaters and dolls.  She makes the dolls and then distributes them to various stores where they sell crafts.  She works from 7am until 6pm and through this business supports her children.  Her dream is to expand the business selling crafts.  She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies to make dolls like fabric, wool and paint at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make dolls.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La socia Francisca; continua con su negocio de panadería, y sigue elaborando tortas, panes, pasteles entre otros productos como maicillos, condesas y otros, la socia desea el credito para poder invertir en la compra de harina al por mayor, manteca, mantequilla, levadura para elaborar y preparar los diferentes pasteles y panes para venderlos en la panadería.
texts.en: Francisca continues with her bakery making cakes, bread and other baked goods among other products like “maicillos,” “condesas” [types of cookies] and others.  She wants the loan to buy flour at wholesale, shortening, butter and yeast to make the various cakes and bread to sell in the bakery.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies.

loans.name: Viviana De Los Angeles

texts.es: Viviana de los Ángeles tiene 32 años de edad, la actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de cosméticos, tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes le ofrece su producto, este negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante y en su casa que la visitan sus clientes. Ella tiene 2 niños en el cual todavía se encuentra a su cargo y que están estudiando, cada día ella busca como salir adelante para darle a sus hijos lo mejor. Viviana de los Ángeles está solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de cosmético.
texts.en: Viviana de los Ángeles is 32 years old and sells cosmetics.  She has regular and occasional customers to whom she offers her products.  She conducts her business door-to-door and customers also come to her home.   She has two children still under her care who are students.  Each day she looks for ways to get ahead in order to give her children the best in life.  Viviana de los Ángeles is requesting funding to purchase a variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon hombre trabajador, emprendedor. Tiene planes de mejorar su nivel de vida. Con su negocio de ventas de artículos variados de uso diario y eléctricos siendo su fuente de trabajo. Con el préstamo  anterior compra mercadería siendo de gran beneficio ya que logro colocar su productos y capto nuevas clientelas.  Esta solicitando este nuevo ciclo de préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en productos como: disco cd para mp3, sencillos, cargadores de teléfonos celulares, protectores de teléfonos, baterías, cables de dvd, aceite para automóvil. Terminales, lámparas de mano, controles, auriculares, así también shampoo con cera, agua esterilizada para batería, entre otros productos que le generara beneficio económicos así poco a poco ir alcanzando su objetivo de mejorar su nivel de vida.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo continuo al desarrollo de su negocio y como persona alcanzando sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Marlon is a hardworking and diligent man who has plans to improve his standard of living with his business of selling a variety of household and electrical articles.  With the previous loan he bought merchandise and that was a boon to his business since he succeeded in selling the products and attracting new customers.  He is requesting a loan for this new cycle to continue investing in products such as: CD discs for MP3 players, cell phone chargers, phone cases, batteries, DVD cables, car oil, terminals, flashlights, controls, earphones and also wax shampoo, distilled water for batteries, and other products that will give him some earnings.  Thus little by little he will be able to achieve his goals and improve his life.
He is grateful to the financial institution for the continued support in the development of his business and for helping a person reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ilva

texts.es: Ilva está muy satisfecha con su creikiva, pues desde la ciudad de Bucaramanga, caracterizada por el perfeccionamiento en la fabricación de productos en tela y en cuero,  le envíaron la ropa, el calzado, los bolsos elaborados en cuero y con una calidad inimitable y ella los vendió en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  a tradicionales clientes de los cuales conoce su trayectoria y ellos también dieron fe de la calidad de sus productos.  Sus principales clientes se encuentras en los estratos 3 y 4 muy cerca al sector donde ella habita con su familia, a quienes les ofrece los productos al detalle a crédito y de contado ocasionalmente. En la actualidad está aplicando a su septimo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y segundo credikiva,  con el que comprará calzado y vestidos, que desde ya tiene encargado, para responder a pedidos que han hecho las familias en las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, pues estas quieren recibir su 2012 bien elegantes y así estarán con la mercancía que le venderá Ilva.
texts.en:
Ilva is very satisfied with her Kiva loan, since from the city of Bucaramanga, characterized by the perfecting of the manufacture of cloth and leather products, she was sent clothing, footwear, and leather purses of inimitable quality, and she sold them in the city of Barranquilla to her usual customers who are familiar with her route and who have faith in the quality of her products. Her primary customers are derived from the middle-class neighborhoods very near the area where she lives with her family, to whom she offers retail products on credit and occasionally for cash. 

Currently she is applying for her seventh loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her second Kiva loan, with which she will buy footwear and dresses which have already been ordered, fulfilling orders which families have placed for the Christmas and year-end festivities. These families wish to receive 2012 in quite elegant fashion, and so they will, with the merchandise Ilva will sell them.

loans.use: to purchase footwear and dresses to fulfill customers' orders.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones,chompas,polos y blusas,ella vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panatalones,blusas y polos al por mayor.
La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member continues selling clothes such as pants (trousers), sweaters, tops and blouses.  She makes her sales independently from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Through this business, she provides for her children.  The member's dream is to own sales premises from which to sell her clothing.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, blouses and tops wholesale.

The member is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and tops wholesale

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Carlota;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboracion de quesos y yogurt,la socia elabora estos productos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan como pizzerias y otros clientes,la socia tambien vende los fines de semana en una feria por el centro de la ciudad,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelnate por su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de quesos y yogurt.
texts.en:
The member is Carlota.  She alternates her daily activities with her business making cheese and yogurt.  The member makes these products to sell to her customers that request them of her, such as pizzerias and other customers.  She also sells on the weekend in a market by the center of the city.  The member is a very happy and responsible person who very much wants to get ahead because of her family.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in buying ingredients to make cheese and yogurt.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cheese and yogurt.

loans.name: Flor Margarita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama FLOR MARGARITA es  un grupo de  diez personas  trabajadoras e indígenas con deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y su comunidad de darle una mejor vida a sus familias y a sus paisanos con sus pequeños negocios ya que todas las personas de este grupo son personas con sueños  y con fe en dios por que para ellos no hay imposibles.

La representante de este grupo es la señora  Beda  Sofía una señora trabajadora humilde con sueños por cumplir , ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de chipile con pollo, carne  cruda de marrano ,pollo en chile ajo ,ti Chinda y iguana.
Tiene  cuarenta años de edad y esta felizmente casada con el señor  Martín un señor trabajador que se dedica a la albañilería   desde hace dos años.
Doña Beda como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta de pollos , emplumados ,destazados  y enchilado ,  tiene diez años dedicándose a la venta de pollos le gusta mucho salir a vender en las tardes ya que en la mañana  vende solamente en su casa por que tiene que dejarle almuerzos a sus hijos.
Tiene  cuatros hijos quienes la ayudan en la tarde a vender pollo  sus hijos son: Felipe, Ana  Luisa , Andrea y Daniela.
Su hija ana Luisa  trabaja en una farmacia y en la tardes se  va a  las colonias vecinas a ofrecer en pollo enchilado ya que a ella también le gusta vender pollos y ayudar a su mama , ya que doña Beda a trabajado mucho para que sus hijos estén orgullosos de ella.
También se dedica a la venta de plantas curativas .
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas  pollos para la venta  , ella nos cuenta que le gustaría  tener un criadero  de pollos para vender por  mayoreo a las localidades vecinas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Magali Beatriz que se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Celestina quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Yessenia quien se dedica a la venta de ropa .
Alicia quien se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
Javier quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
Margarita quien se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco.
Adela  quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y ropa por catálogos.
Alejandrina quien se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes.
María Luisa quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.


A nombre de todas las integrantes del grupo Flor Margarita le damos las gracias a fundación Realidad  por ayudar a las personas que desean crecer y mejorarla vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named "Flor Margarita". It is comprised of ten hardworking people of Native Mexican origins who wish to improve their living conditions and their communities. They wish to provide a better life for their families and their fellow countrymen with their small businesses. All of the people in this group have dreams and faith in God, so to them, nothing is impossible.
The leader of this group is Beda Sofía, a humble and hardworking lady with dreams that have yet to be fulfilled. She sells tamales with chicken and chipile, raw pork meat, chicken with pepper and garlic, clam and iguana.
She is 40 years old and happily married to Martín, a hardworking gentleman who has been in bricklaying for the past two years.
Doña Beda, as she is known to her fellow group members, reports that she also sells chickens, feathered, butchered or seasoned. She has been selling chicken for ten years and she enjoys to go out and make her sales in the afternoons. In the mornings she only sells at her home, because she needs to prepare lunch for her children.
She has four children who help her sell chicken in the afternoons. Their names are Felipe, Ana Luisa, Andrea and Daniela.
Her daughter Ana Luisa works at a drugstore and in the afternoons she goes to the neighboring areas to offer seasoned chicken. She also likes to sell chicken and help her mother, since Doña Beda has worked hard in order to make her children proud of her.
She also sells medicinal plants.
She requested the loan in order to purchase more chickens for selling. She comments that she would like to have a poultry farm so she can sell them by wholesale in neighboring villages.
The other member of the group are:
Magali Beatriz, who sells perfumes.
Celestina, who sells food.
Yessenia, who sells clothing.
Alicia, who sells refreshments.
Javier, who sells groceries.
Margarita, who sells fresh fish.
Adela, who sells clothing by retail and catalogue.
Alejandrina, who sells groceries.
María Luisa, who sells shoes.
In the name of all members of the Flor Margarita communal bank, we thank the Fundación Realidad for helping people who wish to grow and improve living conditions for their families.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for selling.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas,lapiz labiales entre otros productos,la socia vende en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues selling beauty products like perfume, cream and lipstick, among other products.  She’s an independent vendor and works from 8am until 7pm.  She supports her children with this business.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her beauty products.  She is asking for the loan to buy creams, perfume and lipstick at wholesale.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la señora ISABEL, ella pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, (28, 26, 12) años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la administración de su combis, ella es empresaria tiene sus combis en la ruta de Cusco Cabildo, prestan el servicio de transporte diarios a los ciudadanos, la socia tiene este negocio desde hace 15 años y lo conoce a la perfección su deseo es incrementar un par de combis mejorados. Nuestra socia socita el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de sus carros y comprar algunos repuestos.

La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member is Isabel who belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank; she’s from the city of Cusco.  She’s 49 years old, married and has three children who are 28, 26 and 12 years old.  

She alternates her household chores with a transportation van service.  She has her vans on the Cusco-Cabildo route and they provide daily transportation services to citizens; she’s been in this business for the last 15 years and knows it perfectly.  Her wish is to increase with a pair of improved vans.  

She’s asking for the loan to service her vehicles and to buy some spare parts.  She’s grateful and states her satisfaction with being able to continue growing with her own business and commits to repay her debt in the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her vans.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas,ella tiene una carreta donde vende chupetes,caramelos,galletas y gaseosas,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas,galletas y caramelos al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her business selling sweets.  She has a cart where she sells lollipops, candy, cookies, and sodas.  She sells on foot from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m.  With this business she gets her children ahead.  The member's dream is to have a grocery store.

The member is requesting the loan to buy sodas, cookies, and candy wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies, and candy wholesale.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Benedicta ,La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes como restaurantes,quintas entre otros,la socia a la vez se dedica a la ganaderia ella cuenta con vacas lecheras siendo este otro ingreso para su familia ya que la socia vende la leche de las vacas ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus animalitos como pasto,alfalfa entre otros y para aumentar un poco mas de cuyes.
texts.en: Benedicta alternates her daily activities with a business raising small farm animals like guinea pigs.  She raises these little animals in order to sell them later to her customers like restaurants and country recreation centers among others.  She also raises livestock and has dairy cows which is an additional source of family income since she sells the milk from the cows.  She is quite a cheerful, responsible person who very much wants to continue moving forward for her family.  She’s asking for the loan to buy feed for her little animals like grass and alfalfa, among others, to increase her guinea pigs a bit.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Haydde

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de verduras y productos remojados, la socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de productos para remojar como morayas, tarwi, trigo, habas entre otros productos para implementar su negocio y seguir prosperando y brindando mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos para remojar y vender.
texts.en: The member continues buying and selling vegetables and soaked products.  She wants to use the loan to buy products to soak like dehydrated, frozen potatoes, tarwi [Andean lupine], wheat and lima beans, among others to stock her business and continue prospering and offering a better quality of life to her family.  She requests the loan to buy products to soak and sell.

loans.use: to buy products to soak and sell.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Las Rosas” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran vulcanizadora, bisutería, producción de frutos secos, peluquería, manualidades, amasandería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de La Serena.
Cecilia integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila, en el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, usa una falda larga a cuadros y una blusa estampada. Además su cabello es color castaño oscuro y usa chasquilla.
Se dedica a la confección de ropa de vestir para colegio y ropa de casa (cortinaje), además a retapizar asientos de buses.
Los días miércoles y jueves se dedica a tapizar en los buses y el resto de la semana confecciona ropa. Trabaja en su casa, ya que hace poco tiempo realizó una ampliación, ahí cuenta con 3 máquinas de coser diferente, dos con puntada recta y una overlock, las tres son industriales.
Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 10 años y continuamente se ha estado perfeccionando en su oficio.
Sus insumos los compra en una distribuidora.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para realizar sus costuras y género para retapizar asientos de buses. 
Sus metas son instalarse en su propio taller, contar con más maquinarias, (bordadora), ya que en las empresas le están solicitando realizar los logos institucionales (insignias), además de brindar una fuente laboral a otras personas. 
Cecilia vive junto a su hija, quien estudia. Uno de sus sueños es instalarse con su taller, para generar mayores ingresos, de esta manera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Comenta además que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy comprometido y responsable.
La Serena es una ciudad al norte de Chile, ubicada en la  Región de Coquimbo, provincia de Elqui. 
Es un importante sitio turístico, especialmente durante el verano, donde la gente va a visitar sus playas. La ciudad se dedica principalmente al sector de los servicios, habiendo varios bancos e instituciones financieras y una variada oferta gastronómica y hotelera. En las últimas décadas, el turismo se ha convertido en unas de las actividades económicas más importantes, además la ciudad es paso obligatorio de cientos de cruceros que arriban a la ciudad de Coquimbo, en donde en La Serena encuentran el lugar de residencia provisoria para visitar la zona y el Valle de Elqui.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Las Rosas” and it has 16 members who all work in different business activities including running a tire repair shop, selling costume jewelry, producing nuts and dried fruit, hairdressing, making handicrafts, baking, etc.

All the members of the bank live in the town of La Serena.  Cecilia is a member of the community bank.  She can be seen in the front row of the photo,  second from the left.  She is wearing a long, checked skirt and a printed blouse.  Her hair is dark brown and she has bangs.

Cecilia's business is making school clothes and soft furnishings (drapes).  She also upholsters bus seats.

On Wednesdays and Thursdays, Cecilia upholsters bus seats and, during the rest of the week, she makes clothes and soft furnishings.  She works from home and, a short while ago, she extended her home.  In her home, she has three different sewing machines: two regular machines and an overlock machine.  All three are industrial machines.

Cecilia has been in this line of work for 10 years and she is continually increasing her knowledge in her field.  She buys her supplies from a distributor.

Cecilia will use her loan to buy supplies for her sewing.  She will also buy material with which to recover bus seats.  Her goals are to set herself up in her own workshop and to own more machines, in particular an embroidery machine as companies are asking her to make institutional logos (emblems).  She would also like to provide a source of work for other people.

Cecilia lives together with her daughter who is studying.  One of her dreams is to set herself up in her own workshop so that she can make more income and thereby provide her family with a better quality of life.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza are giving her to invest in her business.  She says that the group she belongs to is very committed and responsible.

La Serena is a town in the north of Chile, in Coquimbo region, Elqui province.  It is an important tourist town, especially during the summer when people come to visit its beaches.  The town is dedicated above all to the service sector.  There are several banks and financial institutions, and a varied range of dining establishments and hotels.  In recent decades, tourism has become one of the most important business activities in the town.  In addition, the town is an obligatory stopover for the hundreds of cruises that arrive in the city of Coquimbo.  La Serena provides temporary accommodation for people visiting the area and the Elqui Valley.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing and material for upholstering bus seats

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas entre otros y de esta manera tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes ,la socia trabaja en este negocio hace ya un par de años y le va bien ella trabaja todos los dias en su negocio,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia. 
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, and sweets, among others.  This way she has more variety to offer her customers.  She has worked in this business for a couple of years, and it is going very well for her.  She works in her business every day.  She is a very happy and responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead for her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Antonieta Yanet

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tapiceria y carpinteria,ella y su esposo realizan trabajos como mesas,sillas y ventanas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tapiceria.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como pinturas y madera al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues with her upholstery and carpentry business and her husband doing the jobs making chairs, tables and window frames.  She works from 8am until 7pm and supports her children through this business.  Her dream is to expand the upholstery business and is asking for a loan to buy supplies like wood and fabric at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wood and paint at wholesale.

loans.name: Katia Deyanina

texts.es:
Doña Katia, sigue con su negocio, una pulperia, que ha venido aumentando en productos con el objetivo de obtener mejores beneficios, es madre soltera de una hija de dos años, vive en casa de su mama, quien la apoya y es donde tiene su venta.
Es atraves de los prestamo, que ha logrado el volumen de venta al introducir mas mercaderia, y que con este nuevo financiamiento va a comprar quintal de arroz, azucar, bidon de aceite, cereales, productos lacteos, productos enlatados, pote de leche, golosinas entre otros productos que le generen mayor ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Katia continues with her grocery store business and has been increasing the products she offers with the goal of obtaining better profits.  She is a single mother with a two-year old daughter.  She lives in the house of her mother, who supports her, and this is where she sells her products.  By means of the loans, she has increased sales volume by introducing more merchandise.  With the new loan, she will purchase a quintal of rice, sugar, cans of oil, cereal, dairy products, canned goods, pots of milk, sweets, and other products to generate higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, dairy products, and other products that she sells the most

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is a fifty-two-year-old single mother of three children living in Hioma, Uganda. For six years she has been offering secretarial services. She started as an employee and later started her own stationery shop. 

Her major challenge is the recent load shedding (planned periods of power shutdown by power distribution companies, due to acute power shortages) that makes printing and photocopying hard. Her dream is to buy a generator and also have well-stocked stationery. 

Bessie needs the loan to buy reams of paper and cartridges for resale.

loans.use: to buy reams of paper and cartridges for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Xenia Rosa

texts.es: Xenia tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos la cual sigue apoyando ya que están en etapa escolar, ellos  han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Xenia es una mujer emprendedora que actualmente  se dedica a la venta de comida, la cual lo realiza cada fines de semana en eventos como   fiestas patronales, aniversario, etc.  También vende productos de belleza de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. Con su trabajo y perseverancia  Xenia ha podido apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, y de esta manera conseguir una cierta estabilidad económica. El deseo de Xenia es de comprar su propia casa ya que por el momento vive en casa de sus padres.  Con el  crédito recibido lo utilizará para comprar insumos como arroz, fideos, aceite y  así poder preparar sus comidas. Xenia agradece a los prestamistas Kiva ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en: Xenia, aged 37, lives in a common-law marriage and is the mother of three children whom she supports since they are still of school age. They have motivated her to progress. Xenia is an enterprising woman, currently selling food which she prepares every weekend for celebrations, such as patron saint's days or birthdays. She also sells beauty products which generate a higher income to spend on her household. With work and perseverance Xenia was able to pay for household expenses and thus attain some financial stability. Xenia wants to buy her own house, because now she lives with her parents. She will use her loan to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as rice, noodles and oil. Xenia thanks her Kiva lenders since they make her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Asdrubal Gerardo

texts.es:
Asdrubal es un joven de 37 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace algún tiempo Asdrubal se dedica a una porqueriza y hasta el momento tiene 10 cerdos, se inicio hace cinco años en este negocio. Desde que inició este proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Asdrubal es solicitar un préstamo por ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar cerdos y alimento, que necesita para su proyecto de porcicultura. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Asdrubal forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Asdrubal, aged 37, is a young man living with his family in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón, located 150 kilometers south of San José, the capital of Costa Rica. It is elevated 850 meters above sea level. Local crops are vegetables and coffee, and other activities like cattle fattening and pig rearing have developed. There are also a few projects of organic farming and vegetable hydroponics. In addition to agriculture, the community has vehicle repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (coffee bars) and a furniture store.

Asdrubal has been working for some time in his pigsty and so far he has 10 pigs. He began this activity five years ago and has got good results since the beginning, because his business has been widely accepted in his community and the earnings from it have enabled him to bring up his family.

Right now Asdrubal wants to apply for a loan of 300,000 colones to buy pigs and feed for his pigsty. He expects that this loan will help his microbusiness grow and generate more income to improve his living conditions.
